taskbody.context: The Price Rule Builder allows the staff user to set up discount pricing.

step.cmd: Open Price Rules view and click on New button
Enter in the Price Rule Name and Price Rule Percentage amount.
Define Discount Rules (See Price Rules). If the discount is date-driven, use the Start and End Date fields to establish the date range of when the discounts are given.
step.info:
Maximum Quantity - maximum number times that the discount can be applied;leave blank if there are no limit to the number of times that it can be used
• Minimum Quantity - maximum number that cannot be exceeded for this rule is applied to a transaction; leave blank if there is no constraint
• Maximum Number of Uses - minimum quantity of items that must be purchased for the discount to apply; leave blank if there are no constraints
• Source Codes - captures comma-separated list of Source Codes that are eligible for the Price Rule.
• Subscription Plans - captures comma-separated list of Subscription Plans that the discount may be applied. Leave blank to not constrain rule by Subscription Plan.• Badge Types - captures comma-separated list of badge types that identifies a customers eligibility for the Price Rule. Drag and drop badges from tthe Available Badge Types column to the Selected Badge Type column.

step.cmd: Define Price Rules. Select the Type business groups, catalogs, event items, item classes, items, stores or subscription items, that will be used to define the price rule. Once the selection is made, the form refreshes so a corresponding value(s) can be selected in the adjoining field. Then, choose the available value from the corresponding field.
Click Generate Price Rule button. This saves the record and generates the corresponding price rules. The number of price rules that are created is displayed below the Define Price Rule Items section.
